intro: Cyphia lasiandra, commonly known as the velvetleaf cyphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Cyphia lasiandra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and private collections.
